definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: At that time, England was in a Bible war between two English translations.
sentences.chinese: 當時，英國有兩版英譯《聖經》，互相不服氣。

sentences.english: Now, I greatly admire Tom and he was become a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，我很是服氣湯姆，我們成爲了好伴侶。

sentences.english: Man always can't submit to the fate, and always wants to struggle with it.
sentences.chinese: 人總是不能服氣於命運，總想與它鬥一鬥。

sentences.english: My dear boy, I have no idea. This is, as they say, your party.
sentences.chinese: “那你認爲我們是在哪兒呢？”哈利有點不服氣地說。

sentences.english: However, the "and why" part of the subtitle left me unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 然而，題目中“以及爲什麼”的部分讓我不服氣。
經濟學家羅伯特希勒是不服氣。

sentences.english: Cupid was Apollo so say, heart unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 丘比特被阿波羅這麼一說，心裏很不服氣。

sentences.english: Behavioral economists like Richard Thaler are unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 像理查德泰勒行爲經濟學家不服氣。

sentences.english: I was unconvinced by the teacher's criticism.
sentences.chinese: 我對老師的批評感到不服氣。

sentences.english: Is not convinced we not to speak Chinese, converses with English.
sentences.chinese: 不服氣咱們不說漢語，用英文對話。

sentences.english: I hear variations on this claim a lot, but I'm unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 我多次聽到諸如此類的評價，不過很不服氣。

definition: correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
